unnormalised: Automotive Buzz: Delhi Traffic Gets a Fresh Coat of Rules!
normalised: Automotive Buzz: Delhi Traffic Gets a Fresh Coat of Rules!

unnormalised: Ola, Delhiites! Get ready to brush up on your traffic etiquette 'cause things are changing faster than a Maruti 800 on the Yamuna Expressway. Dr. Sharma from the Traffic Police announced a slew of new regulations earlier today, specifically targeting those pesky two-wheeler riders doing the chai-run without a helmet.
normalised: Ola, Delhiites! Get ready to brush up on your traffic etiquette because things are changing faster than a Maruti eight hundred on the Yamuna Expressway. Doctor Sharma from the Traffic Police announced a slew of new regulations earlier today, specifically targeting those pesky two-wheeler riders doing the chai-run without a helmet.

unnormalised: Apparently, cameras are being installed at key junctions like ITO and Dhaula Kuan, ready to catch offenders. Fines are going up – expect to shell out serious Rs. for violations. They are even cracking down on modified silencers, promising a quieter Diwali this year.
normalised: Apparently, cameras are being installed at key junctions like I T O and Dhaula Kuan, ready to catch offenders. Fines are going up – expect to shell out serious rupees for violations. They are even cracking down on modified silencers, promising a quieter Diwali this year.

unnormalised: But wait, there's more! New parking zones are being designated, with hefty penalties for parking outside the lines (no more squeezing into those tiny spots near Chandni Chowk!). Enforcement officers will be patrolling more frequently, especially near schools like DPS R.K. Puram. The Traffic Police also want feedback, so they have set up a portal for suggestions. They're even considering a 'no-honking' zone pilot project in Connaught Place! Rumor has it they're eyeing using AI to optimize traffic flow, hopefully turning those kilometer-long jams into a smooth ride on Marine Drive.
normalised: But wait, there's more! New parking zones are being designated, with hefty penalties for parking outside the lines (no more squeezing into those tiny spots near Chandni Chowk!). Enforcement officers will be patrolling more frequently, especially near schools like D P S R.K. Puram. The Traffic Police also want feedback, so they have set up a portal for suggestions. They're even considering a 'no-honking' zone pilot project in Connaught Place! Rumor has it they're eyeing using A I to optimize traffic flow, hopefully turning those kilometer-long jams into a smooth ride on Marine Drive.

unnormalised: Now all of Delhi needs is 1000 sq ft of parking space!
normalised: Now all of Delhi needs is one thousand square feet of parking space!
